Package mud.model

Class Room

  • java.lang.Object
    • mud.model.GameObject
      • mud.model.Room

  • class Room
extends GameObject
    A discrete place within the MUD's model. At its heart, a world in this MUD is simply a collection of Room objects. Rooms can contain Items and Characters, though Character objects also know what Room they are in and are the ones primarily responsible for managing that relationship.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Room

        public Room​(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String description,
            java.util.List<Item> items,
            java.util.List<Character> characters,
            Door[] doors)
        Creates a new Room object. This is the primary constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of this Room.
        description - The description of this Room.
        items - The Item objects that this Room 'contains'.
        characters - The Character objects initially in this Room.
        doors - The exits to this room, as an array of Door objects, where each position in the array maps to a specific direction. The length of this array should be equal to the number of values in Direction. If there is no door in a certain direction, that position in the array should have a value of null.

    • Method Detail

      • setDoor

        public void setDoor​(Door door,
                    Direction doorDirection)
        Installs a Door in a given Direction.
        Parameters:
        door - The door to install.
        doorDirection - The direction this Door is set to. For example, setting a Door in the NORTH direction means it is the Door that a Character would reach if they moved NORTH within this Room.

      • getDoor

        public Door getDoor​(Direction doorDirection)
        Gets the Door in a given Direction.
        Parameters:
        doorDirection - The direction the Door you are looking for is in.
        Returns:
        The Door in the supplied Direction, or null if there is no Door in that Direction.

      • containsCharacter

        public boolean containsCharacter​(Character theCharacter)
        Checks if a Character is located in this Room.
        Returns:
        True if the supplied Character is within this Room, or false otherwise.

      • addCharacters

        public void addCharacters​(Character... theCharacters)
        Adds the supplied Character objects to this Room. Please avoid using this method directly. At the time of writing, if assertions are enabled, and a supplied Character is in a location other null, the MUD will crash. If assertions are disabled, then the ensuing behaviour will be undefined and dependent on how well subsequent methods handle unexpected null values.
        Parameters:
        theCharacters - A variable number of Character objects to add to this Room. It is perfectly acceptable to supply one Character object if that is all that is needed.

      • removeCharacters

        public void removeCharacters​(Character... theCharacters)
        Removes the supplied Character objects from this Room. Please avoid using this method directly. At the time of writing, if assertions are enabled, and a supplied Character is in a location other null, the MUD will crash. If assertions are disabled, then the ensuing behaviour will be undefined and dependent on how well subsequent methods handle unexpected null values.
        Parameters:
        theCharacters - A variable number of Character objects to remove from this Room. It is perfectly acceptable to supply one Character object if that is all that is needed.

      • findCharacter

        public Character findCharacter​(java.lang.String charName)
        Finds a Character object with the given name.
        Parameters:
        charName - The name of the Character to search for.
        Returns:
        The Character found, or none if no Character with that name is within this Room.

      • addItem

        public void addItem​(Item item)
        Adds an Item to this Room.
        Parameters:
        item - The Item to add.

      • removeItem

        public Item removeItem​(java.lang.String itemName)
        Attempts to remove the specified Item from this Room.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the Item you hope to remove.
        Returns:
        The Item that was removed, or null if no Item was found.
